etymology.description: 茯(茯) (fú, "poria root") + 苓(苓) (líng, "medicinal plant") come together to refer specifically to the medicinal fungus known as poria, used in traditional Chinese medicine for various health purposes.
etymology.interpretation: 茯苓(fúlíng, "poria") is a term from traditional Chinese medicine, where 茯(茯) (fú, "poria root") refers to the part of the fungi used, and 苓(苓) (líng, "medicinal plant") highlights its therapeutic applications.

examples.chinese: 我用茯苓(茯苓)煮汤(煮湯)。
examples.english: I use poria to cook soup.

examples.chinese: 中医认为茯苓能健脾(中醫認為茯苓能健脾)，具有保健作用(具有保健作用)。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngyī rènwéi fúlíng néng jiànpí, jùyǒu bǎojiàn zuòyòng.
examples.english: Traditional Chinese medicine believes that poria strengthens the spleen and offers health benefits.
